intro: Physurus anchorifer, commonly known as the anchor vine, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its root system is fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The anchor vine is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vigorous growth habit.
